clienttimeandweathercontrolmod.config.ti: Whether or not the current time is §6overridden§r

The behavior of how ClientTimeAndWeatherControlMod sets the time 

§6Static§r - The time §6doesn't change§r, akin to having doDaylightCycle off
§9Loop Skip§r - When the §6end time§r is reached, ClientTimeAndWeatherControlMod will set the current
 time §6back to the start time§r
§bLoop Reverse§r - When the end time is reached, the current time will go §6backwards§r
 until the start time is reached, at which point time will go forwards again

The §6time that is set when the mod is active§r, in ticks
When §6Loop Speed§r is greater than §b0§r, then this value corresponds to the §6starting time of the loop§r, in ticks
How quickly the §6time should advance§r, in ticks per second, when looping. Set this value to §b0§r to §cdisable§r looping altogether
The §6start time§r of the loop, in ticks
The §6end time§r of the loop, in ticks
clienttimeandweathercontrolmod.config.in: After changing the time type, the configuration interface automatically refreshes to display the corresponding options
The "Loop Speed", "Start Time", and "End Time" are only automatically restored after the "Loop Skip" and "Loop Reverse" modes can be edited, and other modes can be edited
clienttimeandweathercontrolmod.config.we: Should the original weather behavior be overridden?

The type of weather you want to set

§b Clear §r - No rain or snow, clear skies
§9 Rain/Snow §r - Rain or snow in cold biomes
§5 Thunderstorm/Blizzard§r - Thunderstorm or Blizzard in the cold biome
category.clienttimeandweathercontrolmod: Client Time And Weather Control Mod
clienttimeandweathercontrolmod.config.mo: Should the original moon behavior be overridden?

The type of moon phase you want to set

§bFull Moon§r - Complete circle moon
§9Waning Gibbous§r - Mostly visible but getting smaller
§6Last Quarter§r - Right half visible
§5Waning Crescent§r - Only a small part visible
§0New Moon§r - Completely invisible
§5Waxing Crescent§r - Only a small part visible (left side)
§6First Quarter§r - Left half visible
§9Waxing Gibbous§r - Mostly visible and getting larger
How quickly the §6moon phase should change§r, in phases per second. Set this value to §b0§r to §cdisable§r looping altogether

Moon Phase Preview:
Full Moon → Waning Gibbous → Last Quarter → Waning Crescent → New Moon → Waxing Crescent → First Quarter → Waxing Gibbous → Full Moon

Moon Phase Cycle Intervals:
Loop Speed 1 = 1 second per phase, 8 seconds per full cycle
Loop Speed 10 = 0.1 second per phase, 0.8 seconds per full cycle
Loop Speed 100 = 0.01 second per phase, 0.08 seconds per full cycle
